oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Workers roll barrels in shadow of general store
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two African American men roll heavy barrels on a sloped ramp. William A. Lieders General Merchandise Store, storage barn, and other buildings appear in the background. Attached to a board on the porch roof is a sign: Wittenberg P.O. [Post Office].

The river town of Wittenberg was located in Perry County, Missouri, on the Mississippi River. German Lutherans settled he town in the 1830s. Floods badly damaged the town in 1927 and 1973. The Great Missouri and Mississippi River Flood of 1993 completely decimated the town.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Earl S. Miers River Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: General stores; Inclined planes; Laborers; Waterfronts; Barrels; City & town life; African Americans
